title: Zoë Kravitz and Austin Butler Spotted Hanging Out at Paris Bar After Premiere of Their New Movie ‘Caught Stealing’
description: Austin Butler and Zoë Kravtiz, who play romantic partners in ‘Caught Stealing,’ were spotted hanging out at a popular French bar after the Paris premiere of their new movie on Aug. 21.
content:
Austin Butler and Zoë Kravitz are finding time to hang out and relax together amid their press tour duties for their new film, .

The actor, 34, and The Batman actress, 36 — who play on-screen love interests in the upcoming Darren Aronofsky-directed movie — were spotted chilling together at Dragon bar in Paris after the red carpet premiere of Caught Stealing in France’s capital on Thursday, Aug. 21.

They were photographed hanging out and chatting together, as seen in photos published by Page Six and the .

The Elvis actor and the Blink Twice star have been traveling together to promote their new crime thriller, which also stars Regina King , Liev Schreiber , Matt Smith and Vincent D'Onofrio .

The film follows a “burned-out ex-baseball player” named Hank Thompson (played by Butler), who “unexpectedly finds himself embroiled in a dangerous struggle for survival amidst the criminal underbelly of 1990s New York City, forced to navigate a treacherous underworld he never imagined,” according to a synopsis of the film.

 Never miss a story — sign up for to stay up-to-date on the best of what PEOPLE has to offer​​, from celebrity news to compelling human interest stories. 

Kravitz plays Thompson’s love interest, Yvonne — a role that explains why the two were photographed sharing an on-set kiss in October 2024.

As they've made the rounds to promote the movie, the two costars shared a lighthearted moment when Butler swatted away a bee buzzing near Kravitz on the red carpet at a screening in London on Aug. 19, according to a video shared by the  .

Kravitz was previously engaged to her Blink Twice costar Channing Tatum , whom she first met while casting the thriller. The couple got engaged in October 2023, but called it off in October 2024 after “they realized they're at different stages in life ,” a source told PEOPLE at the time.

As for Butler, he was previously in a relationship with Kaia Gerber , and the two broke up at the end of 2024 after three years of dating. Sources told TMZ that “the relationship just simply ran its course.” Butler previously dated Vanessa Hudgens from 2011 to 2020.
summary: Austin Butler and Zoë Kravitz were spotted hanging out at a Paris bar after the premiere of their new film, Caught Stealing. The actors, who play on-screen love interests in the Darren Aronofsky-directed movie, were seen chatting and relaxing together during their press tour. The film follows a "burned-out ex-baseball player" named Hank Thompson, who is embroiled in a dangerous struggle for survival amidst the criminal underbelly of 1990s New York City. The two have been traveling together to promote their new crime thriller, which also stars Regina King, Liev Schreiber, Matt Smith and Vincent D'Onofrio.
shortSummary: Austin Butler and Zoë Kravitz were spotted chatting together in Paris after the premiere of Caught Stealing, promoting the film alongside their previous relationships.

scraped_sources.text:
Austin Butler & Kaia Gerber Break Up After Nearly 3 Years Together
AUSTIN BUTLER, KAIA GERBER SPLITSVILLLE ... NO LONGER DATING
Austin Butler and Kaia Gerber have kicked off the New Year with a new relationship status -- they're both single ... TMZ has learned.
Sources with direct knowledge tell TMZ ... the couple ended their romantic relationship around the end of 2024 -- which explains Austin's MIA status from Kaia's family trip to Mexico for the New Year. (More on that later!!!)
However, we're told there's no bad blood between the former couple ... the relationship just simply ran its course after a good 3 years together.
The "Elvis" actor and the runway model first began dating in 2021. The pair were practically inseparable for a time, with AB notably helping KG move into a new home back in mid-2023. At the time, it was unclear if they were living there together ... but it still prompted engagement rumors.
Yet, a source close to the couple later shut down chatter the duo was getting married ... even though they were still very much an item.
Alas, the former flames never took their relationship to the next level ... with Austin and Kaia being seen apart more and more in recent months.
As you know, Kaia joined her mom, supermodel Cindy Crawford, and her dad, Rande Gerber, for a family getaway to Cabo San Lucas to ring in 2025. While her brother, Presley Gerber, brought along his girlfriend, model Isabella Jones, for the vacay ... Austin was noticeably absent -- raising many an eyebrow, as he'd typically join them.
Now we officially know why he skipped out on the fun in the sun.
The bright side of this split ... 2 of Hollywood's brightest stars are back on the market!!!
We've reached out to reps for both Austin & Kaia Gerber ... so far, no word back.

Vincent D'Onofrio Says He’s a Proud Disney Adult: 'I Can Never Get Enough' (Exclusive) "I’m a crazy-about-Disney guy," the 'Daredevil: Born Again' star tells PEOPLE By Julie Jordan Julie Jordan Julie Jordan is an Editor at Large for PEOPLE. She has been with the brand for 27 years, writing cover stories and features and managing special issues including the Beautiful Issue and Sexiest Man Alive. People Editorial Guidelines and Nicholas Rice Nicholas Rice Nicholas Rice is a Senior Editor for PEOPLE Magazine. He began working with the brand as an Editorial Intern in early 2020, before later transitioning to staff positions. Nicholas writes and edits anywhere between 7 to 9 stories per day on average for PEOPLE, spanning across each vertical the brand covers. People Editorial Guidelines Published on March 23, 2025 02:00PM EDT Leave a Comment Vincent D'Onofrio. Credit : Rick Wenner Vincent D'Onofrio is a big fan of "the Happiest Place on Earth." Chatting with PEOPLE for One Last Thing, the actor, 65, says he has a deep love for all things related to Disney. "I’m a crazy-about-Disney guy," D'Onofrio — who stars in the Disney+ revival of Daredevil, Daredevil: Born Again — says. "And [my three kids] love it because they’ve grown up there," he continues, referring to daughter Leila, 33, and sons Elias, 25, and Luka, 17. "We’ve actually recreated photos standing in the same place 20, 30 years apart. I can never get enough." D'Onofrio shared more "lasts" with the magazine: Never miss a story — sign up for PEOPLE's free daily newsletter to stay up-to-date on the best of what PEOPLE has to offer, from celebrity news to compelling human interest stories. Sleeping Beauty Castle at Disneyland in Anaheim, Calif. in April 2024. AaronP/Bauer-Griffin/GC Images Charlie Cox Says He Was 'Shocked' Daredevil Was Rebooted Despite an Ongoing Joke with Vincent D'Onofrio (Exclusive) Last superstition The new one is if you’re walking with a loved one, you don’t let anything get between you. Like you don’t pass on either side of a pole, you go the same way. It’s supposed to be good luck. Last time I danced There’s a gala scene in Daredevil, and [costar] Ayelet Zurer and I did a sort of foxtrot. I’m not the greatest in the world, but I’m not afraid to dance. Last thing I learned about myself I’ve been introverted my whole life, so everything I do is an effort to break that way of living. I’m still learning that I can put myself out there and celebrate when I accomplish things. Last game I played Charlie Cox and I were doing press for Daredevil and played a game of impressions. My first card was Taylor Swift, so I just did her movements. I don’t know if I did anything right, but he guessed it right away. Daredevil: Born Again is available to stream now on Disney+. Inside Channing Tatum and Zoë Kravitz's Breakup: 'They Realized They're at Different Stages' (Exclusive Source) "The split is amicable," a source tells PEOPLE By Benjamin VanHoose Benjamin VanHoose Benjamin VanHoose is a Staff Editor on the Movies team at PEOPLE. He has written about entertainment and breaking news for over five years. People Editorial Guidelines Published on November 1, 2024 02:41PM EDT 7 Comments Channing Tatum and Zoe Kravitz on Aug. 19, 2024. Credit : Dave Benett/WireImage What led to Channing Tatum and Zoë Kravitz's decision to call off their engagement? A source sheds light, saying the two stars agreed they were no longer aligned. "The split is amicable. They realized they're at different stages in life," says the source. Tatum, 44, and Kravitz, 35, met when she cast him to play the charismatic villain in her directorial debut Blink Twice, a thriller that debuted in theaters in August. On the press tour, they openly expressed their love for each other in joint interviews. PEOPLE reported Oct. 29, though, that the pair had ended their three-year romance. Says the source, "Channing spends a lot of time in Los Angeles because of his daughter, but Zoë prefers N.Y.C." Channing Tatum Gushed in Last Post with Now-Ex Zoë Kravitz: 'I Got You Forever' Zoe Kravitz and Channing Tatum on Aug. 18, 2024. Nicky J Sims/Getty The Magic Mike actor shares 11-year-old daughter Everly with ex-wife Jenna Dewan, his costar from the 2006 film Step Up. He and Dewan, 43, settled and finalized their divorce in September — six years after their own split. (She's now engaged to actor Steve Kazee, with whom she shares Rhiannon, 4 months, and Callum, 4.) Just hours before Tatum and Kravitz's split news, multiple outlets reported that the two joined the cast of Alpha Gang, an alien invasion movie that'll also star Cate Blanchett, Dave Bautista, Steven Yeun and Riley Keough. Production insiders confirm Tatum and Kravitz still plan to move forward with the project despite their fresh breakup. The source says, "They will continue to work together and are excited about a new project. They both love filming and creating. Channing has a lot of respect for Zoë's focus and passion." Zoë Kravitz Grills Channing Tatum About His Instagram Follows on Lie Detector: 'Y'all Trying to End My Relationship!' Zoe Kravitz and Channing Tatum on Aug. 8, 2024. CHRIS DELMAS/AFP via Getty Never miss a story — sign up for PEOPLE's free daily newsletter to stay up-to-date on the best of what PEOPLE has to offer, from celebrity news to compelling human interest stories. At the Blink Twice Los Angeles premiere in August, Tatum praised Kravitz, telling PEOPLE at the time, "To get to create something with someone that you love is probably one of the most gratifying things other than having a kid with somebody, I think." In a speech that same night, Kravitz, who was previously married to actor Karl Glusman, said Tatum "supported me in every way" throughout the making of the film. “It’s really very cool to get to make a movie, but when you get to do it with the love of your life, it's even cooler,” she said, in part. Of their October breakup, just over two months after that, another source said: "They haven’t been on the same page and grew apart." Close Leave a Comment Read more: Celebrity Celebrity Relationships Celebrity Breakups

Austin Butler Says He Thought He Was ‘Dying’ as He Experienced Symptoms Including Temporary Blindness Butler ignored the signs of burnout saying, “For a long time, I felt that it [acting] had to be a tortured process and I would come out the other side broken" By Kimberlee Speakman Kimberlee Speakman Kimberlee Speakman is a digital writer at PEOPLE. She has been working at PEOPLE since 2022. She has also worked in broadcast television as a reporter for Hawaii-based news station KHON2 News. People Editorial Guidelines Published on August 20, 2025 04:46PM EDT 7 Comments Austin Butler on Aug. 19, 2025. Credit : Karwai Tang/WireImage NEED TO KNOW Austin Butler shared that he once experienced a bout of temporary blindness while on a flight to film 2023'sThe BikeridersThe actor recalled that he was jolted awake with a migraine and "felt like the life was being sucked from my body” Thanks to mentors like Laura Dern, the actor has learned to take better care of himself and find a balance between work and his health Although Austin Butler’s career is soaring, his health didn’t always keep pace. Ahead of the release of his new film, Caught Stealing, the Elvis star, 34, revealed to Men's Health in its September 2025 cover story that while he was on his way to film 2023’s The Bikeriders, he experienced a bout of temporary blindness. The actor said he was jolted awake with a terrible migraine just as the plane was landing, and recalled, “It felt like the life was being sucked from my body.” “I suddenly felt a euphoric sensation, and I actually genuinely thought I was dying,” he added. Butler said he lost his vision for several minutes, but luckily, it slowly returned to normal. Despite this incident, the actor said he continued working and went on to spend the entire day on set. He told the outlet that he wrote off the incident as a side effect of sleep deprivation. Austin Butler on Aug. 13, 2025. Rick Kern/Getty Our new app is here! Free, fun and full of exclusives. Scan to download now! However, according to Central Valley Eye Medical Group, temporary blindness is not a recognized symptom of sleep deprivation. Instead, people deprived of sleep may experience issues such as blurry vision, eyestrain and trouble focusing. According to Healthline, stress or chronic stress can lead to psychogenic blindness, which the outlet noted usually happens after a traumatic event. Butler admitted to Men’s Health that he once believed struggle was essential to his craft when he first began his acting career, and has suffered several health challenges as a result. In addition to migraines, he also dealt with pain in his foot that lasted for months after his press tour for 2024's Dune: Part Two and in 2021, he spent a week in the hospital due to appendicitis-like pain after filming Elvis. Related Stories Austin Butler Shares Bond with Laura Dern, Who Reminds Him of His Late Mom: 'We Connected on a Soul Level' Austin Butler Says 'Caught Stealing' Director Sent Him Photos of Baseball Players’ Butts for Training Inspiration: ‘Look How Thick’ “For a long time, I felt that it [acting] had to be a tortured process and I would come out the other side broken,” he shared of the period where he ignored symptoms of burnout. However, thanks to several mentors, including Laura Dern, he learned that there could be a kind of balance between work and his health and that he didn’t need to sacrifice one for the other. Austin Butler on Aug. 19, 2025. John Phillips/Getty “She’s helping me more and more to see that you can come out the other side, and maybe bits of you have healed, and synthesized, and metabolized," Butler said of Dern, 58. "It can be therapeutic, in a way.” He told Men’s Health that in addition, he learned, “You don’t have to destroy the light.” Never miss a story — sign up for PEOPLE's free daily newsletter to stay up-to-date on the best of what PEOPLE has to offer, from celebrity news to compelling human interest stories. Since then, Butler said he’s grown more comfortable with slowing down and making time for rest and recovery, while still maintaining the same level of commitment to his roles. Butler’s projects this year include Eddington and Caught Stealing. Caught Stealing is in theaters Aug. 29. Close Leave a Comment Read more: Lifestyle Health Celebrity Health

'Dune: Part Two': Everything to Know From the expected release date to the all-star cast, here's everything to know about the Dune sequel By Maggie Kreienberg Maggie Kreienberg Maggie Kreienberg is a senior editor at PEOPLE. She has been working at PEOPLE since 2022. Previously, she was an editor at Brides. People Editorial Guidelines Updated on February 15, 2024 12:31PM EST Credit : Warner bros. entertainment Prepare to re-enter the world of Dune. Shortly after the first Dune premiered in October 2021, production company Legendary confirmed that a sequel was already in the works. "This is only the beginning...Thank you to those who have experienced @dunemovie so far, and those who are going in the days and weeks ahead," Legendary posted on Twitter, adding, "We're excited to continue the journey!" Like the first film, Dune: Part Two is an adaptation of Frank Herbert's 1965 novel of the same name, covering roughly the second half of the book. All-star cast members including lead character Timothée Chalamet, Zendaya, Javier Bardem and Josh Brolin will return in the sequel, alongside new faces like Austin Butler, Christopher Walken and Florence Pugh. "Florence is really special," Chalamet told Variety of his new costar Pugh, whom he previously worked with on 2019's Little Women. "She's an incredible actor. She was incredible in Dune — seriously incredible. She brought a gravitas to the role." Filming for Dune: Part Two wrapped in December 2022, but the release of the highly-anticipated movie was delayed until 2024 due to the strikes in Hollywood. At CinemaCon 2023 in April, it was revealed that Part Two was shot entirely in IMAX. From the official synopsis to the scheduled release date, here is everything to know about Dune: Part Two. What is Dune: Part Two about? Warner bros. entertainment Dune: Part Two picks up right where the first Dune film left off and is based on roughly the second half of Herbert's science fiction novel. According to the film's official synopsis, Dune: Part Two "will explore the mythic journey of Paul Atreides [Chalamet] as he unites with Chani [Zendaya] and the Fremen while on a warpath of revenge against the conspirators who destroyed his family. Facing a choice between the love of his life and the fate of the known universe, he endeavors to prevent a terrible future only he can foresee." In February 2024, director Denis Villeneuve told Polygon that the sequel would be "much more of an action movie." "It allowed me — because the story is, in a way, more simple — to go deeper, and explore more, and the Fremen culture, and the Harkonnen culture," he said. Prior to filming, Bardem, who plays Stilgar, told audience members at the 2022 Cannes Film Festival that the sequel will "surprise people" — clarifying that fans will "be surprised by the way they put it together." Zendaya is also expected to play a larger role in Dune: Part Two. Fans were previously disappointed by the star's limited screen time in the first film — her character, Chani, only appeared for about seven minutes total despite Dune's 2-hour-and-35-minute run time — but Villeneuve promised to "develop some characters" in the second installment. "There are some characters that are less developed that I'm keeping for the second film — that's the way I found the equilibrium," Villeneuve told the Los Angeles Times in 2021. "We tried in [Dune: Part One] to stay as close as possible to Paul's experience. Then, in the second one, I will have time to develop some characters that were left aside a little bit. That's the theory. I hope it will work." Who is in the cast of Dune: Part Two? Momodu Mansaray/Getty ; Michael Buckner/Variety ; Steve Granitz/WireImage Many A-list actors are set to reprise their roles in Dune: Part Two. The cast includes Chalamet, Zendaya, Brolin, Bardem, Dave Bautista, Rebecca Ferguson, Stellan Skarsgård and Charlotte Rampling. New cast members include Pugh as Princess Irulan; Walken as Emperor Shaddam IV; and Butler as Feyd-Rautha Harkonnen, a member of the family that killed Paul's father in the first installment. Léa Seydoux will also appear in the highly-anticipated sequel as Lady Margot. Is there a trailer for Dune: Part Two? Warner Bros. released the first official trailer for Dune: Part 2 on May 3, 2023. The clip begins with Paul (Chalamet) sitting with Chani (Zendaya) in front of a sandy landscape. "It's breathtaking," he says. "When you see sand here, imagine water. If you dive in, you can't reach the bottom." The trailer offers a glimpse into action-packed scenes and gives a first look at Pugh as Princess Irulan and Butler as Feyd-Rautha Harkonnen. Two months later, the second official trailer dropped. The nearly three-minute teaser opens with Paul trying to convince Chani and the Fremen to join him in fighting the Harkonnens. The clip then cuts to the reunion between Paul and Gurney Halleck, played by Brolin. Finally, viewers see the galaxy's emperor, depicted by Walken, call upon Butler's Feyd-Rautha Harkonnen to kill Paul before he and the Fremen reclaim Arrakis. Who directed Dune: Part Two? Jeff Spicer/Jeff Spicer/Getty Denis Villeneuve directed and wrote Dune: Part Two. He also wrote and directed the 2021 adaption. During an appearance at CinemaCon 2023, Villeneuve shared that Part Two will pick up "just where we left" Chalamet and Ferguson's characters as Paul and his mother, Jessica, join the Fremen at the conclusion of the first film. After filming for Dune: Part One wrapped, Zendaya spoke about her experience working with Villeneuve to Empire. "He's so kind and attentive to all of his actors," Zendaya said of the director, adding, "Denis understands what he wants from us but he's also very collaborative, allowing me to have my take on the character as well. I don't want to jinx anything but I can't wait to explore her more. I hope I get to learn more from Denis. I love to learn from people who are great at their job." Zendaya isn't the only one who has positive things to say about Villeneuve. While promoting Dune: Part Two, Chalamet spoke with the Associated Press about his experience working with the director. “Denis is so playful," he said. "It’s like the greatest evidence of self-confidence to me. It’s ultimately a playful, creative exercise to get to direct any movie. The man who takes himself too seriously, is more focused on the people around him, the audience, than the actual product reeks of a movie that’s pretentious.” Other directorial credits for the Canadian filmmaker include Prisoners (2013), Arrival (2016) and Blade Runner 2049 (2017). Where was Dune: Part Two filmed? Chiabella James/Warner Bros According to Collider, the cast returned to Budapest, Abu Dhabi and Jordan to film the sequel. Parts of the upcoming movie were also filmed in Italy, marking a new location for Dune. Filming for Dune: Part Two wrapped in December 2022 and actor Brolin celebrated the feat on Instagram. "Dune did it," he wrote alongside a mirror selfie. When will Dune: Part Two be released? Chiabella James/Warner Bros Dune: Part Two is slated to premiere on March 1, 2024. Close Read more: Entertainment Movies Action Movies

Austin Butler and Zoe Kravitz caught getting flirty at Paris bar as romance rumors swirl: ‘There’s definitely chemistry’
Austin Butler and Zoë Kravitz were caught getting cozy in the City of Love, following their new film’s premiere in Paris Thursday.
In photos obtained by Page Six, the “Elvis” actor appeared to engage in flirty banter with the “Blink Twice” beauty at the dimly lit Dragon bar. At one point, the duo — who co-star in crime thriller “Caught Stealing” — leaned in for an affectionate embrace.
“There’s definitely chemistry between them and they’re loving spending time together promoting the movie,” an insider told the Daily Mail Friday.
They added that it’s “not quite a fully fledged romance but Austin hasn’t been friend-zoned either. Working together on the film was intense as the director Darren Aronofsky is known for pushing his actors.”
The source divulged that promoting the film and “getting to spend time together without that pressure has been the reward for them both” after wrapping the demanding film.
The Daily Mail’s source also explained that the “Dune: Part Two” actor finds Kravitz to be “cool and hilarious.”
“His pals would not be surprised if something progressed,” they added.
Reps for Kravitz and Butler did not immediately respond to Page Six’s requests for comment.
Butler, 34, previously dated model Kaia Gerber, 23, for three years before parting ways in January. An insider told TMZ at the time that there was no animosity, and the split was mutual.
“The Batman” actress, meanwhile, ended her engagement to “Magic Mike” hunk Channing Tatum in October 2024. Kravitz, 36, and Tatum, 45, were first linked in 2021 after being seen out together in New York.
Multiple sources confirmed to People in October 2023 that the couple had gotten engaged. Though neither addressed the report at the time, Kravitz seemingly confirmed the engagement by rocking a massive diamond ring on her ring finger while attending a Halloween party alongside Tatum.
In February, Kravitz confessed she still cares for her ex-fiancé, who was most recently linked to model Inka Williams, 25.
“I love this thing that we made together, and I care for him very much,” she told Elle of her “Blink Twice” co-star.
“Even when you bring up how great his performance is, it warms my heart to hear that, and I’m so happy that all of it happened. I just feel so grateful that we got to go on that journey together.”

Channing Tatum and Zoë Kravitz Split After 3 Years Together, Call Off Engagement (Sources) Multiple sources tell PEOPLE that Tatum and Kravitz — who got engaged a year ago — are going their separate ways By Jack Smart Jack Smart Jack Smart is the Movies Staff Writer at PEOPLE. With 10 years of experience as an entertainment journalist, he previously worked at The A.V. Club and Backstage. People Editorial Guidelines Published on October 29, 2024 06:33PM EDT 78 Comments Zoe Kravitz and Channing Tatum at the Los Angeles premiere of 'Blink Twice' on Aug. 8. Credit : Eric Charbonneau/Getty Zoë Kravitz and Channing Tatum are calling it quits after three years as a couple. Multiple sources confirm to PEOPLE that the Batman actress and Magic Mike actor have called off their engagement. The two first became an item after working together on Kravitz’s feature directorial debut Blink Twice, in which Tatum starred, and got engaged a year ago. Reps for both stars have not responded to requests for comment from PEOPLE. Zoë Kravitz Wants to Make More Movies with Channing Tatum: ‘Our Love Language’ (Exclusive) Tatum, 44, joined Kravitz in seeing a production of a play by Blink Twice costar Levon Hawke in New York City's Red Hook neighborhood on Oct. 6. However, Kravitz, 35, has in recent weeks been spotted out and about without her engagement ring, including on a recent outing with Big Little Lies costar Shailene Woodley. Never miss a story — sign up for PEOPLE's free daily newsletter to stay up-to-date on the best of what PEOPLE has to offer, from celebrity news to compelling human interest stories. Channing Tatum and Zoe Kravitz in 2023. ALEXJR / BACKGRID "Art is our love language," Kravitz told PEOPLE upon Blink Twice’s Aug. 23 premiere when asked about collaborating with Tatum again in the future. "I think it's what we love, and we love talking about it, and experiencing it, and supporting each other.” Zoë Kravitz and Naomi Ackie Say Some Blink Twice Scenes Were So Intense, the Cast Had a ‘Group Hug’ After (Exclusive) “This is what I'll say about creating with someone that you are with or love: I suggest it,” Tatum told PEOPLE in July. “If you are thinking about having a kid or if you're thinking about getting married, go find the hardest possible creative project with your partner.” He added at the time, “When you can look across the room or the set and know that you have the best person that is next to you trying to solve problems, and you're really looking to them for answers just as equally as trying to solve them yourself, that is unbelievable.” On Tuesday, Oct. 29, Deadline reported that Kravitz and Tatum are among the actors cast in alien invasion comedy Alpha Gang, starring and produced by Cate Blanchett. Channing Tatum Cuddles Up with Fiancée Zoë Kravitz in Romantic Tribute: 'I Got You Forever' Kravitz and Tatum first sparked romance rumors when they were photographed riding through the streets of N.Y.C. on a BMX bike in August of 2021. A month later, they were spotted leaving the Met Gala together before Tatum made their relationship Instagram official on Halloween, sharing a snap of him and Kravitz rocking a couple's costume from Martin Scorsese's classic 1976 film, Taxi Driver. Austin Butler Teams with Director Darren Aronofsky in Gritty Caught Stealing Trailer 'Caught Stealing,' based on the novel of the same name, also stars Zoë Kravitz, Bad Bunny and Liev Schreiber By Tommy McArdle Tommy McArdle Tommy McArdle is a writer-reporter on the Movies team at PEOPLE. Tommy joined PEOPLE in 2022. People Editorial Guidelines Published on May 21, 2025 10:30AM EDT 2 Comments NEED TO KNOW Austin Butler stars in the new trailer for Caught Stealing, in which he portrays a former baseball star who grows embroiled in 1990s New York City's criminal underworldMatt Smith, Liev Schreiber, Zoë Kravitz, Regina King, Vincent D'Onofrio and Bad Bunny also star in the new movie from director Darren Aronofksy, his first since 2022's The WhaleCaught Stealing is in theaters Aug. 29 Austin Butler is diving into a 1990s-set New York City criminal underworld in his new movie with director Darren Aronofsky. On Wednesday, May 21, Sony Pictures released the trailer for Caught Stealing, which costars Butler, 33, with Matt Smith, Liev Schreiber, Zoë Kravitz, Regina King, Vincent D'Onofrio and Bad Bunny. The trailer meets Butler's character Hank Thompson and his girlfriend (Kravitz) as his British punk-rocker neighbor Russ (Smith) asks him to watch his cat as a favor. Hank soon encounters two men who assault him outside his apartment after they mistake him for his neighbor and learns that they are mobsters, and he continues to grow further embroiled in New York City's criminal underworld. "Hank Thompson was a high-school baseball phenom who can’t play anymore, but everything else is going okay," reads an official synopsis for the movie. "He’s got a great girl, tends bar at a New York dive, and his favorite team is making an underdog run at the pennant." Austin Butler in Caught Stealing. Sony Pictures Entertainment/YouTube "They all want a piece of him; the problem is he has no idea why," the synopsis adds of the gangsters plaguing Hank throughout the movie. "As Hank attempts to evade their ever-tightening grip, he’s got to use all his hustle to stay alive long enough to find out…" Never miss a story — sign up for PEOPLE's free daily newsletter to stay up-to-date on the best of what PEOPLE has to offer, from celebrity news to compelling human interest stories. Related Stories American Psycho Casting Director Says Austin Butler Is Too 'Beautiful' to Play Christian Bale's Character in Reimagining Austin Butler Says Taking His 'Elvis' Method Approach for 'Dune: Part Two' Villain 'Would Be Unhealthy' Screenwriter Charlie Huston wrote the movie as an adaptation of his 2004 novel of the same name. Butler and Aronofksy, 56, told Vanity Fair recently that they met during awards season in 2022 and early 2023, when Butler was frequently on the red carpet promoting his movie Elvis and Aronofsky was promoting his film The Whale. Butler told the outlet that he first watched Aronofsky's 2000 film Requiem for a Dream as a tween, making the opportunity to work with the director an easy decision. Matt Smith in Caught Stealing. Sony Pictures Entertainment/YouTube Caught Stealing marks Butler's first big screen appearance since last year's Dune: Part Two and The Bikeriders. He also stars in the upcoming thriller from Ari Aster, Eddington, which releases July 18. Kravitz, meanwhile, appears on the big screen for the first time since she acted in her own directorial debut Blink Twice. Griffin Dunne, Benito A Martínez Ocasio and Carol Kane also round out the film's cast. Caught Stealing releases in theaters Aug. 29. Close Leave a Comment Read more: Entertainment Movies Horror & Thriller Movies

Zoë Kravitz Swoons Over This 'Insane' Taylor Swift Skill: 'She's a Really Good Friend' The actress previously said she and Swift bonded after they spent a significant amount of time together in London during the pandemic lockdown in 2020 By Angel Saunders Angel Saunders Angel Saunders has been a writer at PEOPLE since 2023. She’s previously worked at iHeartMedia, IndieWire, and REVOLT. People Editorial Guidelines Published on August 22, 2025 01:02AM EDT Leave a Comment Zoë Kravitz; Taylor Swift. Credit : Karwai Tang/WireImage; Gilbert Flores/Billboard via Getty NEED TO KNOW Zoë Kravitz has a great friend and a great baker in Taylor SwiftWhile promoting her upcoming film, Caught Stealing with Austin Butler, the actress spilled on a yummy, recent delivery from the pop starThe Blink Twice star called the gesture “a really beautiful” thing Zoë Kravitz says being friends with Taylor Swift comes with some tasty perks. During a Wednesday, Aug. 20, appearance on BBC Radio 2’s The Scott Mills Breakfast Show with her Caught Stealing costar Austin Butler, the 36-year-old actress confirmed what many stars have already said — that the pop star, 35, bakes great bread! “She does make very good sourdough bread,” Kravitz said during the interview, adding that Swift’s kitchen skills are “insane.” The Big Little Lies actress said she last received the baked treat from the Grammy winner “like a week ago” after the “Shake It Off” singer sent her the homemade offering. The Blink Twice star seemed to have Butler, 34, sold, as he interjected: “I wanna try that sourdough.” Luckily enough for him, Kravitz assured him that Swift would be happy to have him taste-test her culinary creation. Related Stories Patrick Mahomes Says Taylor Swift Bakes with His Daughter Sterling Kylie Kelce Praises Taylor Swift's 'Badass’ Comment and Hints She Enjoys Singer's Sourdough Mills seemed impressed with the thought of the mega star sending out edible gifts to those in her inner circle, but Kravitz insisted that the sweet gesture has nothing to do with Swift’s fame. “She’s a really good friend. She makes really good bread, and she shares it with her friends,” Kravitz said. Butler called Swift’s sourdough gifts “generous,” while Mills said it was "incredible" to be on the “Cruel Summer” singer’s receiving list. “Imagine anyone sending you bread,” Kravitz shot back, again seeming to separate the deed from the best-selling artist. “It’s really just a beautiful [thing].” Zoë Kravitz; Taylor Swift. TheStewartofNY/FilmMagic; Frazer Harrison/Getty In a November 2022 interview with GQ, the Batman actress said she and Swift spent a significant amount of time together in London during the pandemic lockdown. Never miss a story — sign up for PEOPLE's free daily newsletter to stay up-to-date on the best of what PEOPLE has to offer, from celebrity news to compelling human interest stories. "She was my pod," Kravitz told the outlet. "She was a very important part of being in London, just having a friend that I could see and that would make me home-cooked meals and dinner on my birthday." More recently, Swift made her debut guest appearance on boyfriend Travis Kelce’s New Heights podcast, which he co-hosts with his brother Jason Kelce. During her visit, the “Look What You Made Me Do” singer spilled adorable details about her “granny” hobbies that “could be categorized as hobbies you could have had in the 1700s,” such as sewing purses and baby blankets for Jason and his wife Kylie, painting, cooking and her “very deep” love for baking sourdough bread." Newly single Austin Butler and Zoe Kravitz get VERY intimate at late-night bar... as friends dish on their 'chemistry'
Austin Butler and Zoe Kravitz sent romance rumors into overdrive with their extremely flirty display at a Paris bar this week.
The Caught Stealing co-stars, who are both fresh out of high-profile romances with Kaia Gerber and Channing Tatum respectively, were seen drinking, hugging and leaning in close to one another while out late at trendy hotspot Dragon after their film's premiere on Thursday.
Elvis star Butler, 34, looked intently at a stunning Kravitz, 36, during the pair's cozy chat - with an insider exclusively dishing on their 'chemistry' to the Daily Mail.
'There's definitely chemistry between them and they're loving spending time together promoting the movie,' the insider said.
'It's not quite a fully fledged romance but Austin hasn't been friend-zoned either. Working together on the film was intense as the director Darren Aronofsky is known for pushing his actors.
'Promoting it and getting to spend time together without that pressure has been the reward for them both.
Austin Butler and Zoe Kravitz sent romance rumors into overdrive with their extremely flirty display at a Paris bar this week
The two actors previously sparked romance rumors following their respective splits, however a source poured cold water on the claims when speaking to TMZ
'Austin thinks Zoe is cool and hilarious, his pals would not be surprised if something progressed.'
The Daily Mail has contacted representatives for Austin Butler and Zoe Kravitz for comment and has yet to hear back.
The pair star alongside Hollywood legend Liev Schreiber as well as former Doctor Who star Matt Smith, Vincent D'Onofrio, Regina King and Bad Bunny in Darren Aronofsky's comedy crime film.
As per Deadline, the film 'follows Hank Thompson (Butler), a burned-out former baseball player, as he's unwittingly plunged into a wild fight for survival in the downtown criminal underworld of '90s New York City.'
Caught Stealing marks Butler's latest high-profile role after starring in Dune: Part Two.
The Dune sequel - which also starred Timothee Chalamet, Zendaya and Florence Pugh - has raked in over $700million worldwide since it premiered in March last year.
The American actor earned his first Golden Globe and an Oscar nomination for Best Actor in 2023 for his portrayal of the late music icon Elvis Presley in Baz Luhrmann's acclaimed 2022 musical biopic.
Elvis catapulted him to A-list stardom — over two decades after he found fame in the early 2000s as a child star on Nickelodeon.
The Caught Stealing co-stars were seen drinking, hugging and leaning in close to one another after their film's premiere
Elvis star Butler, 34, looked intently at a stunning Kravitz, 36, during the pair's cozy chat - with an insider exclusively dishing on their 'chemistry' to the Daily Mail
The pair were letting loose amid their intense press tour
Butler leaned in and hugged Kravitz during their drinks
The pair wore matching black ensembles during the evening
The superstars looked close as they chatted after the premiere
Kravitz enjoyed a drink as she chatted with Butler
'There's definitely chemistry between them and they're loving spending time together promoting the movie,' an insider said
Butler split from Kaia Gerber, 23, at the end of of 2024 after three years (pictured together in April 2023 in NYC)
Kravitz split from fiance Channing Tatum, 45, in October 2024 (pictured August 2024)
As for Kravitz, the daughter of rock star Lenny Kravitz released her directorial debut film Blink Twice in late August after years of working in front of the camera.
Her acting credits include HBO's mini-series Big Little Lies, Hulu's now-cancelled show High Fidelity and The Batman (2022) with Robert Pattinson and Colin Farrell.
Butler's split from Cindy Crawford's model daughter Gerber, 23, after a three-year romance was revealed in January.
They were first linked back in December 2021.
Prior to his relationship with Gerber, Butler had been in a long-term relationship with Vanessa Hudgens from 2011 to 2020, and was reportedly with his Elvis co-star Olivia DeJonge for several months in 2020, before being seen sharing a kiss with Lily-Rose Depp in August 2021.
Kravitz and Tatum, 45, ended their engagement in October 2024.
The couple had begun dating after the actor starred in Blink Twice.
Prior to kicking off their relationship three years ago, Kravitz was coming off a divorce from her first husband, the actor Karl Glusman, while Tatum had only recently finalised his divorce from Jenna Dewan, with whom he has one daughter.

Zoë Kravitz and Channing Tatum's Relationship Timeline Zoë Kravitz and Channing Tatum called off their engagement in October 2024 By Skyler Caruso Skyler Caruso Skyler Caruso is a Writer and Reporter of PEOPLE Digital Entertainment. She joined PEOPLE in 2021, but has eight years of experience working in digital publishing with a focus on entertainment and pop culture news. People Editorial Guidelines Updated on February 26, 2025 08:56AM EST Channing Tatum and Zoe Kravitz in New York City in October 2021. Credit : Elder Ordonez / SplashNews.com Actors Zoë Kravitz and Channing Tatum have called it quits. In October 2024, multiple sources told PEOPLE that Kravitz and Tatum called off their engagement after three years together. "The split is amicable. They realized they're at different stages in life," an insider said. Romance rumors swirled when Kravitz cast the Magic Mike actor in her film, Blink Twice, in early summer 2021. The pair were soon spotted on strolls in New York City, leaving the Met Gala together and sporting a couple's costume for Halloween. In 2022, the couple began speaking about each other in interviews, and Tatum attended the New York City premiere of The Batman alongside Kravitz's stepfather Jason Momoa. Tatum and Kravitz eventually got engaged in October 2023. Prior to dating Kravitz, Tatum wed his Step Up costar, Jenna Dewan, in 2009, and the couple welcomed their daughter, Everly, in 2013 before finalizing their divorce in 2019. Kravitz, daughter of musician Lenny Kravitz and actress Lisa Bonet, married actor Karl Glusman in 2019, but the couple split 18 months later. From getting engaged to their sudden split, here's everything you need to know about Zöe Kravitz and Channing Tatum's relationship. January 4, 2021: Zoë Kravitz and Channing Tatum spark dating rumors Elder Ordonez/SplashNews.com Following Kravitz and Glusman's split in January 2021, the actress sparked dating rumors with Tatum. Although the couple had been working together on Blink Twice — which was then titled Pussy Island — a source confirmed to PEOPLE that they were not dating. "They're working together on an upcoming project and it's not true that they're dating," the source said. June 15, 2021: Zoë Kravitz opens up about casting Channing Tatum During an interview with Deadline, Kravitz opened up about Tatum being her first choice to star in her directorial debut. "[He was the one] I thought of when I wrote this character," she told the outlet in the summer. "I just knew from Magic Mike and his live shows, I got the sense he's a true feminist and I wanted to collaborate with someone who was clearly interested in exploring this subject matter." There was instant chemistry between the two as they worked on the project and "things turned romantic fast," a source told Us Weekly at the time. August 19, 2021: Zoë Kravitz and Channing Tatum are spotted publicly together for the first time The Image Direct Kravitz and Tatum were seen riding through the streets of N.Y.C. on a BMX bike on Aug. 19, 2021. The actress draped her arms around Tatum's shoulders as she stood on the pegs of the back wheel while he peddled. Just a few days later, the duo was spotted drinking large iced coffees while sharing a laugh, continuing to enjoy their time together in N.Y.C. Channing Tatum Says Zoë Kravitz Influences His Style as He Strips Down for Sexy V Man Shoot August 29, 2021: Channing Tatum follows Zöe Kravitz on Instagram While neither Tatum nor Kravitz confirmed their relationship with an Instagram post, the Magic Mike actor did start following Kravitz. He proceeded to follow several fan accounts dedicated to the actress, as reported by Cosmopolitan. September 1, 2021: Several sources confirm Zoë Kravitz and Channing Tatum's relationship In September, sources told PEOPLE that the two "continue to be inseparable" during their time spent in N.Y.C. "They spent the weekend in N.Y.C., strolled around the city, met up with friends and visited the Guggenheim Museum," a source said. "They looked very happy. They have this cute and flirty chemistry." September 14, 2021: Zoë Kravitz and Channing Tatum leave the Met Gala together James Devaney/GC Images Although Kravitz and Tatum walked the 2021 Met Gala carpet separately, they were spotted leaving the event together. The actress, who donned a crystal Saint Laurent by Anthony Vaccarello slip gown, and Tatum attended the exclusive Cincoro Tequila Met Gala afterparty hosted by Alicia Keys. October 22, 2021: Zoë Kravitz and Channing Tatum show PDA for the first time A month after attending the Met Gala afterparty, Kravitz and Tatum were seen holding hands on their way to get lunch in N.Y.C. Tatum also wrapped his arm around Kravitz's shoulder, while both were sporting chic looks to stay warm. October 31, 2021: Zoë Kravitz and Channing Tatum wear a couple's costume for Halloween Channing Tatum/Instagram For Halloween in 2021, Tatum uploaded a cute picture of himself beside Kravitz as the two rocked a couple's costume from Martin Scorsese's classic 1976 film, Taxi Driver. A source told PEOPLE, "They are more relaxed lately. They don't seem to care about hiding their relationship anymore. It's obvious that they are very happy." November 15, 2021: Zöe Kravitz gets to know Channing Tatum's daughter A source told PEOPLE in November 2021 that Kravitz is getting to know Tatum's daughter Everly, whom he shares with ex-wife Dewan, saying it was a move that "only seems natural." The source continued, "He is a very loving dad. He also acts very serious with Zoë." February 2022: Channing Tatum talks about Zoë Kravitz in interviews While he didn't give Kravitz a label other than "friend," Tatum spoke highly about Kravitz in two interviews published in February 2022. While speaking to Variety about Kravitz's directorial debut Blink Twice, which stars Tatum, the actor noted that he advised Kravitz not to act in the film based on his experience as star and codirector of the 2022 film Dog. "I was like, 'You'll need double the days,'" Tatum explained. "She's a perfectionist in the best possible way." Then, in an interview with his 21 Jump Street costar Jonah Hill for V Man magazine, Tatum credited his personal fashion style in part to Kravitz's influence. "Some friends of mine, like you and Zo [Zoë Kravitz] were like, 'Why don't you just wear what you wear? Why don't you just be you?'" he told Hill. "You gave me some very specific style tips." February 14, 2022: Zoë Kravitz opens up about Channing Tatum in an interview TheImageDirect.com Though still not confirming her relationship with Tatum, Kravitz shared a glimpse of her feelings when asked about the actor during her March 2022 Elle cover story on Feb. 14, simply stating that she's "happy." "Looking at his work and hearing him speak about Magic Mike and the live show, I'm like, I think he's a feminist," Kravitz said about casting him in Blink Twice. "You need to be so far from who this is, where it's not scary. And I don't think we've ever seen him play someone dark. I'm excited to see him do that." February 28, 2022: Channing Tatum supports Zoë Kravitz at The Batman premiere Jason Momoa Instagram On Feb. 28, Jason Momoa, who recently split from Kravitz's mother Lisa Bonet, shared a photo alongside Tatum as the two prepared to board a flight to attend the premiere of Kravitz's latest film, The Batman. "CHEEEEHUUUUUUUU. SO EXCITED @channingtatum and I are on our way to see our ZOZO," Momoa began the caption of his post. "Finally @thebatman premiere. I'm so beyond proud of you @zoeisabellakravitz all my aloha to @adamweitsman and @daveophilly for making this happen at the last minute. mahalo @wbpictures for the invite." The Aquaman star later chatted with PEOPLE (The TV Show!)'s Jeremy Parsons at the premiere on March 1, calling Tatum a "wonderful" person. "Oh yeah," Momoa said when asked whether he approved of Kravitz's boyfriend. "He's wonderful ... she's a big girl." March 2022: Channing Tatum is "proud" of Zoë Kravitz's Batman success Following the opening weekend of The Batman, a source told PEOPLE that Tatum "has been telling friends how proud he is of Zoë," for her performance as Catwoman in the film, adding, "He is a huge fan of her acting." Later that week, an insider told PEOPLE that the couple "seem very happy" and "still have this playful energy that they have had since they first started dating." Despite their busy schedules, the sources said that Kravitz and Tatum "continue to spend time together on both coasts" but were "uncomfortable with the attention" they received when they first started dating and have opted to be more "discreet." August 16, 2022: Zoë Kravitz discusses working with Channing Tatum on Pussy Island Kravitz opened up about working with Tatum on her directorial debut for WSJ. Magazine's Fall 2022 Women's Fashion issue. "When you make things with people it's a very sacred space, and when you're compatible with somebody creatively it often opens up other channels, because you're kind of sharing all of yourself," Kravitz said. She added, "I'm really grateful that this movie has brought him into my life that way." The actress-turned-director also explained why she cast Tatum in the thriller, saying she wanted "someone who hadn't played a dark character before because I think that's exciting to watch someone who's mostly played boy next door, good guy, love interest, all of that." "I felt, even from afar, before I knew him, that he was a feminist and that he wasn't afraid of exploring that darkness, because he knows he's not that," she continued. "That's why I was drawn to him and wanted to meet with him. And I was right." August 2022: Channing Tatum and Zoë Kravitz mark one year together with an Italian vacation To celebrate their one-year anniversary, Tatum and Kravitz headed to Italy together, where they were photographed kissing on a yacht. "They are very happy," a source told PEOPLE, adding, "Channing is serious about Zoë. It's not a casual relationship. They have been exclusive for a long time." September 20, 2022: Channing Tatum and Zoë Kravitz wear matching outfits in N.Y.C. Tatum and Kravitz had a matching moment in September 2022. The couple were seen walking hand-in-hand down the streets of N.Y.C. in similar wide-leg brown pants; paired with black shirts and sunglasses. November 15, 2022: Zoë Kravitz talks about working with Channing Tatum on the set of Blink Twice Kravitz opened up about her relationship with Tatum in an interview for GQ. "He makes me laugh and we both really love art and talking about art and the exploration of why we do what we do," she said. "We love to watch a film and break it down and talk about it and challenge each other." The Batman star also praised Tatum for acting as her guardian on the set of Blink Twice, which was still titled Pussy Island at the time. "Whether it was making me tea or pouring me a drink or going to whip someone into shape or whatever — he really was my protector and it was really wonderful and sweet," she explained. Kravitz added, "I think if you can do something like that together, it's a good test. And we came out even stronger." January 17, 2023: Channing Tatum admits to following Zoë Kravitz fan accounts During an interview with Vanity Fair, Tatum talked about why he followed Instagram fan accounts dedicated to Kravitz when the two were getting to know each other. "I have no chill," he said. "I was just seeing what she was up to!" He added, "Also, I didn't know anyone would know." August 19, 2023: Channing Tatum and Zoë Kravitz attend Margaret Qualley's wedding The couple were guests at Margaret Qualley and Jack Antonoff's wedding in New Jersey. Tatum donned a beige suit jacket and black pants, while Kravitz turned heads in a black strapless dress and kitten heels. They mixed and mingled with their fellow attendees, including Taylor Swift. October 30, 2023: Sources confirm that Channing Tatum and Zoë Kravitz are engaged Karwai Tang/WireImage; Anthony Harvey/Shutterstock Several sources told PEOPLE that Tatum and Kravitz are headed for marriage. Photos of the couple leaving a Halloween party seemingly confirmed the engagement as Kravitz was spotted sporting a massive diamond ring. January 4, 2024: Lenny Kravitz shares his reaction to Zoë Kravitz's engagement news Speaking to Entertainment Tonight on the red carpet of the Palm Springs International Film Festival, the music legend commented on his daughter's engagement. "When your family is happy, when your child is happy, that's it — I've done well. Blessed,” he said. January 27, 2024: Zoë Kravitz shares new photo with Channing Tatum to celebrate movie Blink Twice Zoe Kravitz and Channing Tatum. Zoe Kravitz Instagram In a post on Instagram, Kravitz shared behind-the-scenes photos from the set of Blink Twice, including a Polaroid photo where she posed beside Tatum, sticking her tongue out, alongside pictures of her hanging out in front of a trailer and at work behind the camera. In her caption, the debut director shared the film's release date as August 23, 2024. August 8, 2024: Zoë Kravitz and Channing Tatum attend the premiere of Blink Twice Rodin Eckenroth/Getty The couple walked the red carpet together in coordinating black ensembles at the Los Angeles premiere of Blink Twice. "To get to create something with someone that you love is probably one of the most gratifying things," Tatum told PEOPLE of working alongside his fiancée on the film. Kravitz added: "We got to work together and go through hard things together and support each other, and it was beautiful." August 21, 2024: Zoë Kravitz says she wants to make more movies with Channing Tatum While talking to PEOPLE about working with Tatum on Blink Twice, Kravitz said she hopes they can work together again in the future. "I mean, I think that art is our love language," she said. "I think it's what we love, and we love talking about it, and experiencing it, and supporting each other.” She went on to say that it was "awesome" to see Tatum play the bad guy. “It was awesome because he was doing such a good job, and as an actor, I'm like, ‘This is delicious stuff that he's never gotten a chance to do,' " Kravitz said. "And also, he's doing this part because he's an ally. He wants to tell this story.” October 29, 2024: Sources confirm Zoë Kravitz and Channing Tatum's split Channing Tatum and Zoë Kravitz in 2024. Dave Benett/WireImage Multiple sources confirmed to PEOPLE that Tatum and Kravitz have called off their engagement and are going their separate ways after three years together. The couple have yet to comment on the breakup. The breakup had taken place the weekend before the news became public. A source told PEOPLE, "They haven’t been on the same page and grew apart." February 25, 2025: Zoë Kravitz breaks her silence about split from Channing Tatum Kravitz addressed her breakup from Channing in an interview with ELLE and expressed her gratitude for their time together. "I care for him very much," the actress said, adding that she's "so grateful" for the journey they shared on Blink Twice. "I’m so happy that all of it happened. He’s got a lot to offer." argos_summary: Austin Butler and Zoë Kravitz, co‑stars of Darren Aronofsky’s crime thriller Caught Stealing, were photographed relaxing together at Paris’s Dragon bar after the film’s premiere, sparking speculation about their off‑screen chemistry. The pair, who have both recently ended high‑profile relationships—Butler with model Kaia Gerber and Kravitz with actor Channing Tatum—have been seen sharing friendly moments during the press tour. Their on‑screen romance in the film, where Butler plays a former baseball player drawn into New York’s criminal underworld and Kravitz plays his love interest, has fueled rumors of a real‑life connection. Despite the buzz, both actors have denied a romantic relationship, saying they are simply enjoying each other’s company while promoting the movie. The coverage also highlights the film’s plot and the broader context of their recent breakups.
